intro: Shuttleworthia diceras, commonly known as the narrow-leafed shuttleworthia, is a small perennial shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to semi-arid climates. Shuttleworthia diceras plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
